intro: Celmisia haastii, commonly known as the Haast's celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with a clump-forming habit. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native range.
